metadata.title: A Formal Theory of Commonsense Psychology: How People Think People Think
metadata.authors: Andrew S. Gordon and Jerry R. Hobbs
metadata.description: Chapter 22 axioms covering similarity, difference, analogies, patterns, and cognitive comparison processes
metadata.notation: First-order logic with reified eventualities and recursive similarity definitions

axioms.title: Definition of similarInThat
axioms.fol: (forall(x y e1 e2) (iff(similarInThat x y e1 e2) (and(arg* x e1)(arg* y e2)(subst x e1 y e2)(Rexist e1)(Rexist e2))))
axioms.english: x and y are similar in that e1 holds for x and e2 holds for y, where e1 and e2 are substitutable properties that both really exist

axioms.title: Definition of differentInThat
axioms.fol: (forall (x y e1 e2) (iff (differentInThat x y e1 e2) (and (arg* x e1)(arg* y e2)(subst x e1 y e2)(Rexist e1) (not (Rexist e2)))))
axioms.english: x and y are different in that e1 holds for x but the corresponding property e2 does not hold for y

axioms.title: Definition of similar0
axioms.fol: (forall (x1 x2) (iff (similar0 x1 x2) (exists (m p) (and (null m) (or (simPr0 x1 x2 m) (and (eventuality x1)(eventuality x2) (simStr0 x1 x2 m)))))))
axioms.english: Two entities are similar0 if they have similar properties or if they are eventualities with similar structure

axioms.title: Definition of simStr0 - similar structure
axioms.fol: (forall (e1 e2 m) (iff (simStr0 e1 e2 m) (or (equal e1 e2) (exists (p d m1) (and (pair d e1 e2)(addElt m1 m d) (pred p e1)(pred p e2) (forall (n x1 x2 d1) (if (and (argn x1 n e1)(argn x2 n e2) (pair d1 x1 x2)(not (member d1 m))) (simPr0 x1 x2 m1))))))))
axioms.english: Two eventualities have similar structure if they are equal or have the same predicate and similar arguments

axioms.title: Definition of simPr0 - similar properties
axioms.fol: (forall (x1 x2 m) (iff (simPr0 x1 x2 m) (exists (d m1) (and (pair d x1 x2)(addElt m1 m d) (or (equal x1 x2) (exists (e3 e4 p n d1) (and (pred p e3)(pred p e4) (argn x1 n e3)(argn x2 n e4) (pair d1 e3 e4)(not (member d1 m)) (simStr0 e3 e4 m1))))))))
axioms.english: Two entities have similar properties if they are equal or share a property with the same predicate and corresponding arguments

axioms.title: Definition of similar1 - graded similarity
axioms.fol: (forall (x1 x2 s) (iff (similar1 x1 x2 s) (exists (m p) (and (null m) (or (simPr1 x1 x2 m s) (and (eventuality x1)(eventuality x2) (simStr1 x1 x2 m s)))))))
axioms.english: Two entities are similar1 with shared properties s if they have similar properties or similar structure as eventualities

axioms.title: Definition of simStr1 - graded similar structure
axioms.fol: (forall (e1 e2 m s) (iff (simStr1 e1 e2 m s) (or (and (equal e1 e2)(singleton s e2)) (exists (p d) (and (pair d e1 e2)(addElt m1 m d) (pred p e1)(pred p e2) (iterArgs e1 e2 1 m1 s1) (addElt s s1 e2))))))
axioms.english: Two eventualities have similar structure with shared properties s, either by equality or by having the same predicate and similar arguments

axioms.title: Definition of iterArgs - iterate through arguments
axioms.fol: (forall (e1 e2 n m s) (iff (iterArgs e1 e2 n m s) (exists (x1 x2 d1 s1 s2 n1 n0) (and (argn x1 n e1)(argn x2 n e2) (pair d1 x1 x2)(addElt m1 m d1) (if (member d1 m)(null s1)) (or (member d1 m)(simPr1 x1 x2 m s1)) (successor n1 n)(arity n0 e2) (if (leq n1 n0)(iterArgs e1 e2 n1 m1 s2)) (if (gt n1 n0)(null s2)) (union s s1 s2)))))
axioms.english: Iterate through corresponding arguments of two eventualities to accumulate shared properties

axioms.title: Definition of simPr1 - graded similar properties
axioms.fol: (forall (x1 x2 m s) (iff (simPr1 x1 x2 m s) (or (and (equal x1 x2)(eventuality x2)(singleton s x2)) (and (equal x1 x2)(not (eventuality x2))(null s)) (exists (d m1 t) (and (pair d x1 x2)(addElt m1 m d)(null t) (iterProps x1 x2 t m1 s) (not (null s)))))))
axioms.english: Two entities have similar properties with shared property set s, handling equality cases and iterating through properties

axioms.title: Definition of iterProps - iterate through properties
axioms.fol: (forall (x1 x2 t m s) (iff (iterProps x1 x2 t m s) (or (exists (e3 e4 p n t1 d1) (and (pred p e3)(pred p e4) (argn x1 n e3)(argn x2 n e4) (not (imply t e4)) (addElt t1 t e4) (pair d1 e3 e4)(addElt m1 m d1) (if (member d1 m)(singleton s1 e4)) (or (member d1 m)(simStr1 e3 e4 m s1)) (iterProps x1 x2 t1 m1 s2) (union s s1 s2))) (null s))))
axioms.english: Iterate through inferentially independent properties of two entities to find matches

axioms.title: Equivalence theorem for similar0 and similar1
axioms.fol: (forall (x1 x2) (iff (similar0 x1 x2) (exists (s) (and (similar1 x1 x2 s)(not (null s))))))
axioms.english: Two entities are similar0 if and only if they are similar1 with a non-empty set of shared properties

axioms.title: Subset consistency for similarity ordering
axioms.fol: (forall (x y z) (if (and (similar1 x z s1)(similar1 y z s2) (properSubset s2 s1)) (moreSimilar x y z)))
axioms.english: If x and y are both similar to z, and x's shared properties with z properly contain y's shared properties, then x is more similar to z than y is

axioms.title: Definition of moreSimScale
axioms.fol: (forall (p1 p2 e) (iff (moreSimScale p1 p2) (exists (x y z) (and (pair p1 x z)(pair p2 y z) (moreSimilar x y z)))))
axioms.english: One pair is more similar than another if the first element of each pair is more similar to their common standard than the second

axioms.title: Definition of similarityScale
axioms.fol: (forall (s) (iff (similarityScale s) (exists (s1 e p1 p2) (and (forall (p)(if (member p s1)(pair0 p))) (moreSimScale' e p1 p2) (scaleDefinedBy s s1 e)))))
axioms.english: A similarity scale is defined by the moreSimScale relation over pairs

axioms.title: Definition of similar - high on similarity scale
axioms.fol: (forall (x z) (iff (similar x z) (exists (s s1 p) (and (similarityScale s)(Hi s1 s)(inScale p s1) (pair p x z)))))
axioms.english: Two things are similar if their pair is in the high region of a similarity scale

axioms.title: Definition of different - low on similarity scale
axioms.fol: (forall (x z) (iff (different x z) (exists (s s1 p) (and (similarityScale s)(Lo s1 s)(inScale p s1) (pair p x z)))))
axioms.english: Two things are different if their pair is in the low region of a similarity scale

axioms.title: Symmetry of similarity
axioms.fol: (forall (x y) (iff (similar x y)(similar y x)))
axioms.english: Similarity is symmetric - if x is similar to y, then y is similar to x

axioms.title: Definition of ceMapping - composite entity mapping
axioms.fol: (forall (m x1 x2) (iff (ceMapping m x1 x2) (exists (u1 s11 s12 s13 u2 s21 s22 s23) (and (union3 u1 s11 s12 s13)(componentsOf s11 x1) (propertiesOf s12 x1)(relationsOf s13 x1) (union3 u2 s21 s22 s23)(componentsOf s21 x2) (propertiesOf s22 x2)(relationsOf s23 x2) (function m u1 u2) (forall (y1) (if (member y1 s11) (exists (y2) (and (member y2 s21)(map m y1 y2))))) (forall (y1 y2 e1 e2 n p) (if (and (member y1 s11) (or (member e1 s12)(member e1 s13)) (map m y1 y2)(map m e1 e2)) (and (iff (argn y1 n e1)(argn y2 n e2)) (iff (pred p e1)(pred p e2)))))))))
axioms.english: A composite entity mapping preserves components, properties, relations, and their structural relationships

axioms.title: Definition of exhibitPattern
axioms.fol: (forall (x p) (iff (exhibitPattern x p) (exists (m) (and (pattern p)(patternInstance x p) (ceMapping m p x)))))
axioms.english: A composite entity exhibits a pattern if it is an instance of the pattern with a proper mapping

axioms.title: Definition of commonPattern
axioms.fol: (forall (x1 x2) (iff (commonPattern x1 x2) (exists (p) (and (exhibitPattern x1 p)(exhibitPattern x2 p)))))
axioms.english: Two composite entities have a common pattern if they both exhibit the same pattern

axioms.title: Definition of cePredReplace
axioms.fol: (forall (m p x1 x2) (iff (cePredReplace m p x1 x2) (exists (s12 s13 u1) (and (propertiesOf s12 x1)(relationsOf x13 x1) (union u1 s12 s13) (forall (e1 e2 q1 q2) (if (and (member e1 u1)(map m e1 e2) (pred q1 e1)(map p q1 q2)) (pred q2 e2)))))))
axioms.english: Composite entity predicate replacement maps one entity to another by changing predicates according to mapping p

axioms.title: Definition of structureMapping
axioms.fol: (forall (m p x1 x2) (iff (structureMapping m p x1 x2) (exists (x3) (and (cePredReplace m1 p x1 x3) (ceMapping m2 x3 x2) (iff (map m x y) (exists (z) (and (map m1 x z)(map m2 z y))))))))
axioms.english: A structure mapping combines predicate replacement with composite entity mapping

axioms.title: Definition of analogous
axioms.fol: (forall (x1 x2) (iff (analogous x1 x2) (exists (m p) (structureMapping m p x1 x2))))
axioms.english: Two things are analogous if there is a structure mapping between them

axioms.title: Definition of compare
axioms.fol: (forall (a x y) (iff (compare a x y) (exists (e1 e2 e3 e4) (and (thinkOf a e1)(thinkOf a e2) (similarInThat x y e1 e2) (thinkOf a e3)(thinkOf a e4) (differentInThat x y e3 e4)))))
axioms.english: To compare entities is to think about their shared and differing properties

axioms.title: Comparison causes similarity or difference judgment
axioms.fol: (forall (e0 a x1 x2) (if (and (compare' e0 a x1 x2) (etc)) (exists (e e2 e3 e4) (and (cause e0 e)(changeTo' e e2) (or (thinkThat' e2 a e3)(thinkThat' e2 a e4)) (similar' e3 x1 x2)(different' e4 x1 x2)))))
axioms.english: Comparing entities defeasibly causes one to think they are either similar or different

axioms.title: Similarity scale as comparison metric
axioms.fol: (forall (s) (iff (comparisonMetric s)(similarityScale s)))
axioms.english: A similarity scale constitutes a comparison metric

axioms.title: Definition of findPattern
axioms.fol: (forall (e0 a x1 x2) (iff (findPattern' e0 a x1 x2) (exists (e e2 e3) (and (changeTo' e e2)(thinkThat' e2 a e3) (commonPattern' e3 x1 x2)(gen e e0)))))
axioms.english: To find a pattern in two things is to come to think that pattern holds in them

axioms.title: Definition of drawAnalogy
axioms.fol: (forall (e0 a x1 x2) (iff (drawAnalogy' e0 a x1 x2) (exists (e e2 e3 m) (and (changeTo' e e2)(thinkThat' e2 a e3) (structureMapping' e3 m x1 x2)))))
axioms.english: To draw an analogy between two things is to think that a structure mapping holds between them

conversion_notes.recursive_complexity: Chapter features highly recursive similarity definitions with loop prevention mechanisms
conversion_notes.graded_similarity: Introduces both binary (similar0) and graded (similar1) notions of similarity
conversion_notes.structural_mappings: Sophisticated treatment of analogies through structure mappings and predicate transformations
conversion_notes.cognitive_processes: Bridges computational similarity with psychological processes of comparison and analogy
conversion_notes.loop_prevention: Complex bookkeeping with 'm' parameter to prevent infinite recursion in similarity checking
conversion_notes.scale_integration: Integrates with general scale theory from earlier chapters for similarity judgments

file_format_notes.co_recursion: simPr0/simStr0 and simPr1/simStr1 are mutually recursive definitions
file_format_notes.iterative_predicates: iterArgs and iterProps handle systematic traversal of structure
file_format_notes.mapping_complexity: ceMapping and structureMapping represent sophisticated structural correspondence
file_format_notes.reified_cognition: Cognitive processes like compare', findPattern', drawAnalogy' are reified as eventualities
file_format_notes.defeasible_reasoning: Only one axiom (22.25) uses defeasible reasoning with (etc)
